message: Yes, finally an actual release of Haven. Now before you get overly excited, note that this will not be a feature complete release. It will start with just account management and the basics required for that. From there we will make frequent releases adding more features and fixing whatever bugs we find along the way.
Just account management? Isn't that a BEAuth release then? And I thought uploads/downloads worked already?

@TheAncientGoat No, it's not a BEAuth release, that code will probably never see a 'release'. And uploads do work, but I'm not going to release 'anything' until I have sufficient test coverage to make sure things 'stay' working.
Er, so uploads won't be available until you write tests for them, but you'll release the version with accounts before that?
@TheAncientGoat Yes. Technically I don't know if I'll finish tests for accounts either, but they're easy enough to test manually until I finish the tests.
Are you going to run a demo somewhere?

Although on that topic, the release may be delayed a few days since I've been sick and haven't had the expected time to work on it. :| Ahh well, I'm still pleased with optimistic release dates, keeps things moving quicker.
@bartbes Yes, I'll be running an official version on our server.
Optimistic release dates have a lesser positive effect than missed release dates have a negative effect

@TheAncientGoat Pretty much. Lots of work got done that otherwise probably would have been put off. Hopefully I'm feeling better and can get some serious work done. I don't want to promise anything, but I may have it finished just a couple days late.
@BiosElement uh oh.. not *another* delayed release..
@bartbes Oh, but doesn't it feel much closer?

@bartbes Chill. The release date was optimistic and got a lot of work towards it done. Now I'm just finishing up the error handling and making sure it won't blow up. I may even have it done by tonight.
Just two minor issues remain till we're ready for a 0.1 release. https://github.com/BiosInteractive/Haven/issues/2 and https://github.com/BiosInteractive/Haven/issues/3
Blast, storing UUID's as bytecode is far more difficult then it could be. Clearly I'm totally ignorant of the correct way to do this.

Problem is that you will still have to manually install sqlalchemy 0.7b2 since the beta isn't on pypy yet. This is due to the use of experimental 'hybrid' attributes which make it a tad easier to store password information and keep all the actual processing of the password in the Account model.
We've really been more/less ready to release for a week now but I've held off the release to fix up the buildout system which makes it easier to 'install'.
Haven v0.1.0 is released: https://github.com/BiosInteractive/Haven/tree/v0.1.0
Also, how about announcing it on the forums? Kind of a mess up for this to only be announced on Twitter/Identica and Convore, which a very small amount of the  community uses
Released, but not hosted. Pretty cool though nonetheless
@TheAncientGoat Already on it
